result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. HEIDI J HENDERSON

records.addlTxt:
Defendant HEIDI J HENDERSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for HEIDI J HENDERSON.  Attorney Scott Zehr in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and notes appearances. 21CF319 
Attorney Rivard states a resolution has been reached for all matter. 

Court also calls 22CF426, 22CF440

Defendant waives preliminary hearing in 22CF426 and 22CF440

DRI all remaining charges and 22CF427,22CF439 in their entirety and will order PSI

21CF319 Ct 1 defendant enters no contest plea
State advises it is a PTAC Modifier in 2nd amended information
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
22CF426 Ct.1 (will mimic criminal complaint) defendant enters no contest plea
22CF440 Ct.1 (will mimic criminal complaint) defendant enters no contest plea
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.
Factual basis and probable cause found. 

Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty and to be held until PSI is completed.
Long form PSI, Author need not be present.

Attorney Rivard addresses court re bond that has been posted and requests court grant release on these matters for inpatient treatment. 
Court addresses the state regarding bond.
Attorney Zehr responds that all cash bonds have been posted.
Court amends 10,000 total cash bond to cover all cases while in custody at CHSJ; if at Infinity treatment facility will be a Signature Bond/standard drug conditions.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Offer received that covers all cases including new cases.  No resolution.
Trial currently scheduled to proceed.  Any cases not addressed in trial to be heard at next review hearing.

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant HEIDI J HENDERSON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for HEIDI J HENDERSON. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF426 & 22CF427. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
ADA Zehr informs the Court he failed to file the information in cases 21CF655, 21CF758, 22CF23 and moves to dismiss. 
ADA Zehr requests any money to be returned to poster. 
Court grants dismissal and orders money to be returned. 
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant HEIDI J HENDERSON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lester H Liptak appeared by video for HEIDI J HENDERSON.

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
